item.title: Creating and configuring Entra Extension Attributes
item.description:
This post describes the step-by-step process of creating and configuring Entra ID Extension Attributes — custom properties that can be added to directory objects such as users or groups to store additional metadata beyond the standard schema.

1. Create an Application Registration

Application Registration serves as a namespace for your extension attributes — it defines what attributes exist and on which object types they can be used.

1

$app = New-MgApplication -DisplayName "Extension Attribute Sample Application" -SignInAudience AzureADMyOrg

2. Create a Service Principal

This is a critical step that is often overlooked. Without a Service Principal, the extension attributes are defined but cannot be used — the application exists only as a definition, not as an active entity in your tenant.
